# Apigee - API hub provisioning permissions
**    Preview    — Apigee API hub ** This feature is subject to the "Pre-GA Offerings Terms" in the General Service Terms section   of the [Service Specific Terms](/terms/service-terms#1) .     Pre-GA features are available "as is" and might have limited support.    For more information, see the [launch stage descriptions](/products#product-launch-stages) .
content:
## Roles
The following user roles provide permissions that control access to the API hub functions:
**Note:** The preview release provides coarse-grained access control and four basic roles. Fine-grained access control and integrations with other parts of Apigee are planned for the GA release.
- **Admin:** Full access to all the resources in the Registry plus planned features for  automated provisioning and instance management
- **Editor:** Edit access to API hub and Registry resources.
- **Viewer:** Read-only access to API hub and Registry resources.
- **Worker:** Predefined role for Apigee Registry application workers to read and update  API Registry resources.## Set up IAM permissions
See [IAM roles](/apigee/docs/api-hub/iam-roles) for detailed permissions information.
To add users and roles:
- In the Google Cloud console, go to **IAM & Admin** for your project. [Go to the IAM/Iam page](https://console.cloud.google.com/iam-admin/iam) 
- To add a new user:- Click **Add** .
- Type a new **Principal** name.
- Click the **Select a role** menu, click **Apigee Registry** , and then click one   of the following:- Cloud Apigee Registry Admin
- Cloud Apigee Registry Editor
- Cloud Apigee Registry Viewer
- Cloud Apigee Registry Worker
- Click **Save** .
- To edit an existing user:- Clickedit **Edit** .
- To change an existing role, click the **Role** menu and then select a different role.
- To add another role, click **Add another role.** 
- Click the **Select a role** menu, click **Apigee Registry** , and then click one   of the following:- Cloud Apigee Registry Admin
- Cloud Apigee Registry Editor
- Cloud Apigee Registry Viewer
- Cloud Apigee Registry Worker
- Click **Save** .
